chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Craig Allen Linzmeier was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig Allen Linzmeier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dept of Corrections payment Ck P2406170
request for furlough and response from Court

Defendant Craig Allen Linzmeier in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 3.  All other counts and 15TR760 & 15TR761 will be dismissed.  Atty Sheets agrees.
Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 3.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  Court questions Atty Sheets.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 3:  Operating with a PAC as a 6th Offense.  Cts 1-2 will be dismissed along with charges in 15TR760 & 15TR761.
Arguments by counsel.

BY THE COURT:  Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 36 months with the following conditions:
*Pay fine of $600.00 plus court costs.
*AODA and comply with any recommendations.
*Serve 6 months in the Marquette County Jail with huber.  Sentence to commence forthwith.  May be transferred to Portage County if accepted.
*36 month DL revocation.
*36 month Ignition Interlock.
*Submit DNA sample if not already provided and pay $250 surcharge.
  
**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Defendant Craig Allen Linzmeier in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR760 & 761 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Sheets; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Sheets agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Sheets states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.
Atty Sheets enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Craig Allen Linzmeier
Current: 2809 Algoma Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2015)
Prior: 2524 Jefferson St, Stevens Point, WI 54481
letter from Atty Hendee asking to reset the Prelim scheduled for August 19th; officer not available.  Ok'd by Judge.

Defendant Craig Allen Linzmeier in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Sheets states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Sheets waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

CASES TRACKING TOGETHER:
15CF29 - OWI 5th/6th
15TR760 - Seatbelt Violation
15TR761 - Speeding

Defendant Craig Allen Linzmeier in court with attorney Mark Gumz appearing by telephone .  Defendant Craig Allen Linzmeier in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant does not qualify for PD, however, he is going to appear with the defendant today.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Gumz states that in speaking with the defendant this morning, the defendant is working and requests a $250 cash bail.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance


Court questions Atty Gumz regarding the time limits for the Prelim.  Atty Gumz asks that this be set for an Initial Appearance due to the defendant may be getting an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets an Initial Appearance.  
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
